title: World Rugby have failed in their duty to complete the pool stage - this Rugby World Cup has been damaged
text:
The job of dealing with a ‘super typhoon’ was unenviable but World Rugby have failed in their duty to make sure the pool stage was completed in a way that was fair for all and which preserved the event’s integrity.

If Japan-Scotland goes ahead on Sunday, some of the heat will be taken out of the debate raging here in Tokyo, but New Zealand-Italy and England-France have already been lost. In all cases, the organisers have rejected two opportunities: 1. To reschedule games for Monday or Tuesday next week and 2. To move them to cities unlikely to be affected by Typhoon Hagibis - though...
